alert.note: Alert for Bienville; De Soto; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Red River; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jackson, southeastern De Soto, southeastern Red River, northern Natchitoches, southwestern Ouachita, southeastern Bienville, southern Lincoln and northwestern Winn Parishes through 1230 AM CDT... At 1148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Grambling to 9 miles northwest of Jonesboro to 15 miles north of Campti to 6 miles southwest of Coushatta. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Ruston, Claiborne, West Monroe, Grambling, Jonesboro, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Coushatta, Campti, Choudrant, Simsboro, Martin, Chatham, Clarence, Hodge, Goldonna, North Hodge, Vienna and Dodson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; De Soto; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Red River; Winn
